author: Elizabeth Winkler
title: Twitter Makes Money—Beautiful!
text:
Twitter finally solved the Twitter problem. The home of presidential tweet storms and chatty journalists has never been able to turn those rants into profits. On Thursday it did just that, reporting its first-ever net profit and returning to revenue growth after three quarters of declines.

Twitter’s earnings per share came in at 19 cents, five cents above expectations, with revenue of $732 million, beating analyst expectations of $686 million. Notably, advertising revenue increased 7% year-over-year. The company has finally...
